div.p: // I śaka 1261, māghamāsa, tithi navamī kr̥ṣṇapakṣa, ma, U, A, vāra, vuye

Irikā divaśa rakryan· juru
puspadanta, mvaṁ (k)utāvarṣaṇāmnaṅ a(ṁ)vyavahāra, makalaga mpu sāvitra tlas· pingat de saṁ mantrī tumapəl samudāya
mvaṁ saṁṅ upapati, makaprasthāva pati mpu sāvitra sāhasāṅalih i rakryan· juru puspadanta malap· lmaḥ kabha
gavānan· sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkana pakṣa mpu sāvitra, kunaṁ pakṣa rakryan· juru puspadanta lmaḥ saṅke kuli§
t kaki Ikaṁ bhinuktinya sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkanāṁvivāda ya tika pinametakən pramāṇa, Inundaṁ taṁ sasiriṅan· sa
taṅgəḥnyaṁ kāliḥ makādi I sumbul·, liṁnyan tinañan·, siṅgiḥ pukulun· juru puspadanta madr̥vya Ikaṁ savaḥ-sa
vaḥ sapuluḥ liriḥ I sagiri, yapvan ikaṁ savaḥ kabhagavanan· sapuluḥ liriḥ muvaḥ, maṅkanājarnya makabehan·,

vva
ntən· ta pukulun· paṅhulu bañunya rvaṁ kupaṁ sovaṁ, kataṅgapan denikaṁ rāma sumbul·, vyaktyanyan bheda, muva§
h ajar iṁkaṁ juru mantən· maṅaran gambyok·, Aki gaṇḍi yo pukulun· vka bhagavān· riṁ kr̥ta, muktyakən ikaṁ sa
puluḥ liriḥ juga, Antara saṅkerika, mpu kili nuda, vkasan saṁ mapañji śūrajaya muktyakən kabhagavānan katkeṁ
maṅke, kevalātutur ikaṁ sa/pu\luḥ liriḥ juga, pisaniṅu vyāparāṅipikipika Ikaṁ savaḥ kaparathaniAn· nāṁ
sapuluḥ liriḥ, maṅkana varaḥ kihadyan· gambyok·, yatika pinramāṇakan saṁ mantrī samudāya, mataṁ
nyan· balavān· rakryan· juru puspadanta, sor mpu sāvitra, pratyeka saṅ amgat·, rakryan· raṅga Aki taṅga, muvah aki
kape, rakryan· kanuruhan· Aki jo, muvaḥ mahiṣāṅivuṁ, rakryan· tuməṅguṁ Aki makara, muvah aki raṅgāsəm-asəm·
, rakryan· dmuṁ Aki R̥ma, muvah aki goleṁ, rakryan apatiḥ ravi, muvaḥ rake mali, saṁ prāṇapati, makādhipati
saṅ āryya śūrasiṅha, muvaḥ saṁ bhujaṅga mantrī, saṁ mapañjy antaraga, saṁ mapañji cāyaguṇa, saṁ pamgət saliṅsiṅan·, makā-
di saṁ mapañji surapati, muvaḥ saṁ pamgət i kaṇḍamuhi, samgət· pamvatan·, samaṅkana kveḥ saṅ amgat· ,,,

app.note: A second akṣara na is written above the ligature nta. The engraver would have probably realised that he was beginning to write too high, and stopped after the first akṣara, then rewrote nta at the proper place.

div.p: Hail! In the elapsed Śaka year 1338, such was the time that His Majesty of Talonan took over in turn (hanimbal) the piece of land (varukira) of the Lord at Paguhan, he who was released in the highest abode (saṅ lina riṁ pramalaya). [It] was received (kataṅgap) by the One whose task is to Speak (de nira saṅ aṅucap gave) at the (stone) building Didiwa, by the patiḥ səmut (litt. master Ant), by the arya pagəḥ (the Venerable Pagəh), by the arya Guna (the Venerable Guna), by the patiḥ at Paguhan (by the master at Paguhan), by the patiḥ Sərəg, by the patiḥ at Tembeṁ, those are the people who received money. The amount of money [is]: 200.000, two hundred thousand, two hundred thousand in total (gənəp), on Kliwon (kaliwon), the thirteenth [day] of the waxing fortnight, the month of Asuji, signed by (litt. “bearing the name”) Sakawasa.

First edited by F.D.K. Bosch (104-105); dating formula re-edited by Damais (110-111A.205); edited again by Boechari (119E.60); re-edited here by Marine Schoettel and Arlo Griffiths from photographs by Georges Groslier (EFEO Paris GROB03770 and GROB03771).
